defs: = ಕಪಟತನ.
the act, plan or scheme of a fradulent person or a hypocrite.
a man skilled in cheating others.
a man who is guileless, frank, honest, naive, etc.
a woman who is guileless, frank, honest, naive, etc.
any clothes, equipment, manner, etc. used for disguising or cheating.
a person in disguise.
the mendicancy of a person who, by wearing a saiṇṭs dress and posing to be pious, cheats others.
a person in the disguise of a saint or a mendicant.
a person in the disguise of a saint or a mendicant.
= ಕಪಟಗಾರ.
= ಕಪಟಗಾರ್ತಿ.
the quality of a cheat; the tendency to deceive others.
(masc.) a cheat; a fraud; a swindler.
(fem.) a cheat; a fraud; a swindler.
= ಕಪಟಹೃದಯ.
a person who cheats; a cheat; a fraud.
a person who pretends to be what he or she is not; a hypocrite.
to cheat; to commit a frud; to swindle.
to act or behave hypocritically.
= ಕಪಟ1.
= ಕಪಟಗಾರ್ತಿ.
any of numerous small passerine birds of Motacillidae family, characterised by long wing feathers and a very long tail that wags up and down; a wagtail.
a man pretending to be a teacher; a tricky rascal.
= ಕಪಟ2.
= ಕಪನಿ.
a long, loose, sleeveless vestment (usu. worn by mendicants); a surplice.
= ಕಪಟ2.

a kind ofrticulate worm with large number of feet, which rolls itself firmly up into a coil when touched.
the brightly coloured, glossy shells of gastropods, found in warm seas; cowrie.
the knotted hair of Śiva.
= ಕಪರ್ದ - 1.
Śiva.
(pros.) the sign for a long unit '-'.
= ಕಪರ್ದ - 1.
= ಕಪರ್ದ - 1.
the shell of warm sea gastropods used in India as currency in olden days.
= ಕಪಾಟು.
= ಕಪಟ2.
a moveable cupboard or wardrobe; an almirah.
= ಕಪಟ2.
a kind of long robe covering from the shoulder to the knee.
the fleshy side of the face below the eye and above and to the side of the mouth; the cheek.
a piece of broken pottery; a pot-sherd.
the skeleton of the head of a vertebrate forming a bony or cartilaginous case that encloses and protects the brain and chief sense organs and supports the jaws; the skull.
a movable cover, hinged or unattached, as for a box, trunk, pot, etc. a lid.
a deep, rounded container or dish, open at the top; a bowl.
a small water-jar with a handle and a nozzle.
a multitude; a collection of large number of items at a place.
a formal agreement between two or more nations, relating to peace, alliance, trade, etc., on equal terms respecting each otheṛs sovereignty.
a slapping on another's cheek.

a kind of yogic breath-exercise.
a pain in the head and the upper parts of the cheecks.
Śiva, who has skull in his hand.
= ಕಪಾಲಹಸ್ತ.
2) a man of low caste (an offspring of a fisherman and a brāhmaṇa woman).
a leather bag for carrying water.
a woman of low caste, being the daughter of a brāhmaṇa woman and a fisherman.
one of the forms of Goddess Durgā.

= ಕಪಾಲ2.
a slapping on another's cheek.

any of various mainly long-tailed agile tree-dwelling primates of the families Cebidae, Callithricidae, and Cercopithecidae; a monkey.
a mischievous person, esp. a child.

the bird Cuculus Melanoleucus.
the bird of Phasianidae family (genus Francolinus); francoline partridge.
a kind of pigeon.

a fragrant, solid resin obtained from a small, East Mediterranean tree (Styrax officinalis) of the storax family, formerly used as incense; storax.
an indecent, unmannerly gesture or gestures.
conduct which is troublesome, but not malicious, esp. in children; a mischief.
= ಕಪಿತಾನ್.
a captain - a) an important military leader; b) the leader of a sports team; c) the leader of a group of persons (in gen.); d) the person in command of a merchant or passenger ship.
the plant Mucuna prurita (= M. puriens) of Papilionaceae family; cat bean.
= ಕಪಿತುರಚಿ.
the quality or qualities of a monkey; the quality or fact of playing fool; mischievousness.
the tree Feronia elephantum.
its fruit; wood-apple.
the plant Girardinia leschenaultiana of Urticaceae family.
(dance) a single hand gesture with the forefinger bent and its tip placed on the tip of the thumb, all the other fingers bent into the palm.
a kind of medicinal preparation in āyurvēda system.
a kind of medicinal preparation (in a tablet form) ināyurvēda system.
a banner with the sign of a monkey.
Arjuna, one of the heros in epic Mahābhārata, whose banner had the sign of Hanumān.
(Jain.) Sugrīva, who also had the sign of a monkey on his banner.
(Jain.) the race who traditionally had the figure of a monkey on their banners.
a long, loose, sleeveless vestment (usu. worn by mendicants); a surplice.
a kind of net to catch monkeys.
(fig.) a firm hold as with the hand's-fist.
(fig.) an obstinate, unyielding person.
(fig.) such an attitude.
an obstinate, adamant, unyielding man.
of orange-brown or yellow-brown colour; tawny.
the orange-brown or yellow-brown colour.
name of a great sage (about 500 B.C.) who is said to have founded the Sānkhya system of philosophy.
a kind of medicinal substance.
of reddish brown colour.
the reddish brown colour.
= ಕಪಿಲಾಷಷ್ಠಿ.
the evergreen tree Mallotus philippensis (= Rottlera tinctoria) of Euphorbiaceae family.

the twentify first day of the sixth month in Hindu Calendar, having the astrological combination of the sun, Rōhiṇī (Aldebaran) star and Hastā (Corvus) star, and the day being Tuesday, (which is supposed to happen once in sixty years).
an instance of kapil āṣaṣṭhi.
(fig.) an occasion that is very rare or never happen at all.
a device having pulley mounted on a stand by the side of a well, leathern bucket, and a rope for lifting water and worked with an ox or a pair of oxen.
a brown cow.
(myth.) the wish-yielding cow of the Heaven.
the tree Dalbergia sissoo (=D. sissosa, = D. sissu) of Papilionaceae family.
the tree Mallotus philippensis (= Rottlera tinctoria) of Euphorbiaceae family.
the plant Aloe perfoliata of Liliaceae family.
a kind of medicinal substance made from this (?) plant.
a kind of perfume.
(myth.) the female of the elephant guarding the south-east quarter.
any of mostly flattened, annelid worms of Hirudinea subclass living in water or wet earth and having a well-developed sucker at each end and are bloodsuckers; a leech.
a brown, uncastrated bull left free.
the creeper officinalis of Araceae family; hog creeper; monkey creeper.
the tree Gardenia latifolia of Rubiaceae family (?).
of reddish brown colour.
the reddish brown colour.
a fragrant resin, obtained from the tree Styrax officinalis and formerly used in perfume; storax.
the head of a monkey.
the upper part of a wall; the top of a rampart.
1) the tree, Spondias pinnata (=S. mangifera) pf Amacardiaceae family.
the tree Thespesia populnea(=Hibiscus populnea) of Malvaceae family; umbrella tree; Indian tulip.
the tree Acacia sirisa of Mimosae family.
the tree Ficus religiosa of Moraceae family; peepul tree.
the tree Ehretia laevis of Ehretiaceae family; Nilagiri ivory wood.
of low quality; mean; worthless; abject.
smelling bad; giving unpleasant smell; disagreeable.
to think deeply (esp.being in distress); to feel distressed.
the outer part of the angle made at the joint between the upper and lower arm; the elbow.
a dove, pigeon.
a small house or box with compartments for nesting pigeons, usu. on a pole; pigeonhole; dove-cot.
a horizontal molding projecting along the top of a wall, building, etc.; the cornice.
a young pigeon.
a mode of folding the hands together.
a kind ofntimony or collyrium.
the effect of a cause or causes , which is supposed to be of reddish brown colour, (one of the six such effects of different colour).
(dance) one of the hand gestures - both the hands are joined at the base, top and side, leaving cavity inside, and the fingers pointing upwards, used in depicting obeisance, humility, fear, etc.
a kind of perfume.

a silvery-white, brittle, nonmetallic chemical element of crystalline structure, found only in combination, used in alloys with metals to harden them and increase their resistance to chemical action, and also in medicines, pigments, and matches, and for fireproofing (symbol. Sb); antimony.
a blind person.
a female pigeon.
= ಕಪೋತಹಸ್ತ.
either side of the face between the nose and ear, below the eye; the cheek.
imagined or supposed to be fact (for one's advantage).
a decorative marking, figure etc. painted on the cheek.
a woman with decorative figures painted on her cheeks.
the broad flat cheeck.

the cancer disease affecting the jaws and the inside of the cheeks.

a captain - a) an important military leader; b) the leader of a sports team; c) the leader of a group of persons (in gen.); d) the person in command of a merchant or passenger ship.
a regular payment of money, etc., made by one ruler or nation to another as acknowledgment of subjugation, for protection from invasion, etc.; tribute.
a ring of gold or silver wire for the wrist or ankle, worn as an ornament or as the sign of a vow to a deity.
a hole, pit in the ground made to catch wild animals.
a deep, broad ditch dug around a farm, garden etc. for avoiding cattle coming in.
a water way for excess rain water to flow out of a areca field.

a movable cover for the top of a container; a lid.

to become very dark.
darkly; blackly; gloomingly.

old, worn clothes.

the tree Cinnamomum camphora of Lauraceae family; camphor tree.

its seed.

(dullness, embarrassment, etc.) to be lost.

a kind of bird.
a brown or black tarlike substance, a variety of bitumen, found in a natural state or obtained by evaporating petroleum; asphalt.
to become black or dark.

income, esp. from illegal activities, not reported to the government so as to avoid paying taxes on it; black money.
a large, smooth, dark surface of slate or other material on which to write or draw with chalk; a blackboard.

any of various families of tailless, leaping anuran amphibians with long, powerful hind legs, short forelegs, a smooth skin, and webbed feet, and that, when grown, are able to live both in water and on land; a frog.

ಅಂಜಿದವನ ಮೇಲೆ ಕಪ್ಪೆ ಎಸೆದಂತೆ anjidavana mēle kappe esedante (a simile) to freighten a person who is already scared; ಕಪ್ಪೆ ಕೂಗಿ ಮಳೆಬರಿಸಿತು kappe kūgi maḷe barisitu a coincidental hapening; the dirt bird sings, we shall have the rains; ಕಪ್ಪೆಗಳನ್ನು ತಕ್ಕಡಿಗೆ ಹಾಕಿದಂತೆ kappegaḷannu takkaḍige hākidante (proverbial simile) it is like trying to bring together different people of divergent views, tastes, etc. for a concerted effort.
a mechanical device furnished with a bolt and, usu., a spring, for fastening a door, strongbox, etc. by means of a key or combination; a lock.
(dial.) a kind of bag made of woven or plaited hemp, straw, rope, etc.
a small compartment in a cupboard.
a game in which one boy jumps over the back of another who is sitting on the ground with his head bent.

an acute infectious disease, usu. affecting children, caused by the bacillus Bordetella pertussis and characterised by a mucous discharge from the nose and later by repeated attacks of coughing that end in a forced intake of breath or whoop; the whooping cough.

water.
